meanings.definition: A strong-smelling substance used to attract animals, especially in hunting.
meanings.sent1: The hunter spread fumets to lure the deer into the area.
meanings.sent2: The fumets helped the tracker attract the wild animals.
meanings.sent3: The fumets were so potent that even the birds came closer for a sniff.
meanings.sent4: The fumets hung in the air like a beckoning call to the forest creatures.
meanings.sent5: The fumets wafted through the woods, promising a feast for the animals.

meanings.definition: The scent or odor of an animal, especially when used as a lure.
meanings.sent1: The hound picked up the fumets of the fox and dashed off in pursuit.
meanings.sent2: The fumets of the rabbit attracted the hungry wolves.
meanings.sent3: The fumets of the skunk made the other animals wrinkle their noses in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The fumets of the bear filled the forest with a warning of its presence.
meanings.sent5: The fumets of the raccoon lingered in the air, tempting the predators.

meanings.definition: The strong-smelling liquid produced by certain animals, such as skunks, as a defense mechanism.
meanings.sent1: The skunk sprayed fumets to protect itself from danger.
meanings.sent2: The fumets of the porcupine warned the curious fox to stay away.
meanings.sent3: The fumets of the skunk were so pungent that even the bravest animals fled.
meanings.sent4: The fumets of the skunk lingered in the air like a potent shield.
meanings.sent5: The fumets of the skunk filled the clearing, deterring any potential threats.
